name: Dumbbell Bench Press
setup: Sit on end of flat bench with dumbbells resting on thighs
Lie back while guiding dumbbells to chest
Feet flat on floor, shoulder blades retracted and down
Start with dumbbells at chest level, palms facing forward, elbows at ~45° to torso
steps: Press dumbbells up and slightly together (arc motion)
Extend arms fully at top, dumbbells nearly touching
Lower dumbbells under control to chest level
Elbows should reach ~90° or slightly below bench level
Pause briefly at bottom, then press back up
mistakes: Flaring elbows out to 90° (increases shoulder stress)
Feet lifting off floor or unstable base
Not achieving full depth at bottom
safety: If shoulders feel cranky, reduce range or load. Keep elbows at 45° to protect shoulder joints. Use spotter for heavy loads.

regressions: Floor dumbbell press (reduces range of motion)
Incline dumbbell bench press (easier on shoulders)
progressions: Pause dumbbell bench press (2-3s at bottom)

prescriptionHints.load: DB 25-60 lb/hand depending on strength and experience
prescriptionHints.notes: Primary chest builder. Start conservative; dumbbells allow greater range of motion than barbell.

joints.notes: Keep elbows at 45° to reduce shoulder stress. Maintain shoulder blade retraction throughout movement.
